snippet: The territory ISIS controls in Iraq produces thousands of barrels of oil that can fetch millions on the Turkish black market, and U.S. officials are leaning heavily on Turkey to take action.
abstract: United States seeks Turkish assistance to starve Islamic State in Iraq and Syria of oil revenue that has made it one of the wealthiest terror groups in history.

byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER and JULIE HIRSCHFELD DAVIS

lead_paragraph: The territory ISIS controls in Iraq produces thousands of barrels of oil that can fetch millions on the Turkish black market, and U.S. officials are leaning heavily on Turkey to take action.

headline.main: Struggling to Starve ISIS of Oil Revenue, U.S. Seeks Assistance From Turkey
headline.print_headline: Struggling to Starve ISIS of Oil Revenue, U.S. Seeks Assistance From Turkey

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
